means: European academic research network 欧洲学术研究网络
[计]= European Academic Research Network,[网]欧洲学院研究网

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"获得，取得，得到"之意
sameAnalysis.word_list: acquire, obtain, gain, get, win, earn, secure
means: acquire ：强调通过不断的、持续的努力而获得某物，也指日积月累地渐渐地获得。书面语用词。
obtain ：较正式用词，着重通过巨大努力、要求而得到所需或盼望已久的东西。
gain ：侧重指经过努力或有意识行动而取得某种成就或获得某种利益或好处。
get ：普通用词，使用广泛，可指以任何方式得到某物，也不一定要经过努力。
win ：主要指通过努力、斗争、比赛等而获得胜利。
earn ：侧重指依靠自己的劳动或因付出代价与有功而获得。
secure ：强调要通过努力或竞争，或需要付出代价才能获得所渴望的东西。

sentence.Network_en: Ray will earn his keep on local farms while studying.
sentence.Network_cn: 雷求学期间会在当地的农场干活赚取生活费。

sentence.Network_en: Players should be allowed to earn money from advertising.
sentence.Network_cn: 应该允许运动员拍广告挣钱。

sentence.Network_en: Young conductors earn their spurs in a small orchestra or opera house.
sentence.Network_cn: 年轻的指挥家们在小乐队或小歌剧院里崭露头角。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)put in a lot of effort to show that one deserves one's wages
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)凭实力获得应得的酬劳

jx.jx_en_mean: work in return for food and accommodation
To gain a position through hard work and the accumulation of experience, often in the face of difficulties
jx.jx_cn_mean: 努力挣得，出名：经常是在面临困难的情况下，某人通过努力工作和经验的积累而获得的一定职位

lj.lj_ly: a diplomat who had earned his spurs as the prime minister's personal assistant.
lj.lj_ls: 外交家经过奋斗获得首相私人助理之职

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English earnian, of West Germanic origin, from a base shared by Old English esne 'labourer'

entry.def: If you earn money, you receive money in return for work that you do.

example.ex: Charlie was earning eight pounds, I was earning five...
example.tran: 查利赚了8英镑，我赚了5英镑。

example.ex: What a lovely way to earn a living...

entry.def: If something earns money, it produces money as profit or interest.

example.ex: ...a current account which earns little or no interest...
example.tran: 利息很少或为零的活期账户

example.ex: We buy everything abroad with the money earned from oil imports.
example.tran: 我们用进口石油赚到的钱从国外购买一切商品。

entry.def: If you earn something such as praise, you get it because you deserve it.

example.ex: Companies must earn a reputation for honesty...
example.tran: 公司必须树立诚信的声誉。

example.ex: I think that's earned him very high admiration.
example.tran: 我认为那一点为他赢得了极高的赞誉。

means.word_mean: 1. earn on some commercial or business transaction; earn as salary or wages;

sentences.sentence: "How much do you make a month in your new job?"
"She earns a lot in her new job"
"this merger brought in lots of money"

means.word_mean: 2. acquire or deserve by one's efforts or actions

auth_sentence.content: They'll earn their spot as the top seeds.

Sentence.sentence: Soon, Americans would need to spend "comparatively little time earning a living".
Those who stay on for an additional two years can earn a master's degree that qualifies them as nurse practitioners (执业护士) or clinical nurse specialists
One advantage of sharing is that owners earn money from renting out items not made full use of.
People can earn more money in fields other than manufacturing.
A father who is rarely at home because he's always working sends the message that men are supposed to earn money

The Three-Year Solution Hartwick College, a small liberal-arts school in upstate New York, makes New York, makes this offer to well prepared students: earn your undergraduate degree in three years instead of four, and save about 543,000—the amount of one year's tuition and fees

sentences.en: He is paid less than he really earns.
sentences.cn: 与他真正该赚得的相比, 他的待遇是太少了。

sentences.en: Her remark earned a laugh from her husband.
sentences.cn: 她的话赢得她丈夫的一笑。

means.word_mean: 使得到, 使获得, 使值得

sentences.en: If you grant my request, you will earn my thanks.
sentences.cn: 如果你答应我的要求, 就会得到我的感谢。

jushi.english: Donald was paid more than he really earns.
jushi.chinese: 唐纳德得到的报酬比他实际挣的要多。

jushi.english: He is paid less than he really earns.
jushi.chinese: 与他真正该赚得的相比,他的待遇是太薄了。

jushi.english: The employer cheated the workers into the belief that they could earn 3000 yuan a month as long as they worked hard.
jushi.chinese: 老板哄骗工人们相信:只要他们努力工作,一个月可以挣到3000元。
